biotools.summary: Phosphoproteome prediction is a tool for predicting phosphorylation levels of the proteome across cancer patients. It integrates four components into itsalgorithm, including (i) baseline correlations between protein and phosphoprotein abundances, (ii) universal protein–protein interactions, (iii) shareable regulatory information across cancer tissues and (iv) associations among multi-phosphorylation sites of the same protein.
